That night, Brad met with Jackson and Jake at a local restaurant. The guys had text him asking to meet them to discuss their poor performance today, and while Brad was still feeling pretty tired from the game, he decided that a little pep talk couldn't hurt. The guys had played pretty badly today, and were clearly getting rather out of shape; it would be hard to justify their presence on the team for much longer...but he didn't plan on telling them that.

The restaurant they had chosen was an 'All you can eat' place, featuring dishes from various different countries. When he walked in, Jake and Jackson were already seated, and waved to him from a booth in the far corner. Brad had to admit, the place smelled pretty dam good. He sat down in the booth and noticed that the guys had already loaded up their plates with a mountain of food, which, given their current condition, probably wasn't a great idea.

"Hey Brad," Jake said before cramming a fork full of pasta into his mouth.

Jackson opened his mouth to speak, but just made a mumbling noise and gestured to the buffet behind them. It was only then that Brad noticed the guys had positioned themselves right next to the food. Wow, no wonder these guys are getting flabby...he thought. None the less, Brad got up and grabbed some food; everything smelled so good, he decided to help himself to his favorites; pizza, a cheeseburger and fries. When he got back to the table, the guys were nearly finished with their first course.

"So, you guys want to talk about the game?" Brad asked, before biting into his pizza.

"Yeah..." Jake said. "We know we both kinda screwed up."

"I could barely keep running in the second half," Jackson admitted.

"Hold that thought, got to load up..." Jake said, hurriedly returning to the buffet for a second helping.

Brad watched Jake waddle back to the food filled table beside them, noticing how tight his clothes were getting. He glanced over at Jackson, who was still filling his face. Despite their worries about gaining weight, neither of the guys seemed to be watching what they ate...

"You know guys...if this is the way you always eat, maybe it's no surprise that you're packing it on," Brad said, amazed by how much food the guys were packing away. "Just an idea."

Jake swallowed, looking hurt. "It's not my fault! I wasn't eating any more than usual at first, but once the first few pounds hit me, I had to keep eating more to stop the hunger pangs."

Jake and Jackson looked roughly the same size to Brad, so he didn't really see where Jake was coming from there, but he just shrugged and carried on eating. Jackson soon returned and wedged himself into the booth once again, his plate piled even higher than before.

"Might want to slow down there buddy," Brad said, gesturing to Jackson's mountainous meal with his fork. "Aren't we supposed to be getting back in shape?"

Brad just shook his head, finishing off the last of his meal. He looked across to see the guys were still eating, and wondered if they would go for another helping after they cleared their plates?

"Urghhhhhhhhhhhhhhh!" Suddenly, Jackson let out a pained groan and dropped his hands to his overstuffed gut.

"Something wrong Jacksssssssurgggggghhhhhhhhhh!" Jake moaned.

Brad got to his feet. "Guys! You okay? You overdo it with the food?"

Jake had worn a T-shirt that might once have exposed his muscles, and when Brad looked over at him, he could see the too-tight top starting to ride up as his chubby belly spilled out. Was he...getting bigger?! Brad leaned in for a closer look, not believing what he was seeing.

"Wh-what's happening to me?" Jake moaned, running his hands over his growing gut in a panic.

Brad wouldn't have believed it if he hadn't seen it with his own eyes, but there was no denying the facts; the guys were getting bigger. He didn't know if it was the food they had consumed, some kind of allergic reaction or just some prank they were pulling...but he didn't like it one bit.

14523212111111.content:
As they pulled out onto the highway, Brad could hear the distant sound of horns honking. He checked his mirrors for an exit, but it was too late; within seconds, he had joined the end of an enormous tailback of traffic, with another dozen cars joining behind him. "Oh shit," Brad thumped the wheel, wishing he had chosen a different route. "Hang on guys, we might be here a while."

Jake was still fidgeting beside him, his fat belly bulging out into his lap, the seat-belt cutting into his exposed flab. Jackson had managed to get comfy in the back seat, but only by leaving his belt unbuckled. Brad would have told him to put it on, but since they weren't even moving, he decided to ignore it. The guys were really looking huge now, maybe two hundred pounds each. Brad didn't know how the hell it had happened, but they had gotten massive in the past half hour, and they hadn't exactly been slender this morning. They must have been right about the whole unexplained weight gain after all. Which meant that the same thing might be happening to him...that thought terrified him. He had also put on some mysterious poundage over the last two weeks, but he figured it was mostly just winter weight he hadn't converted to muscle yet. Besides, wouldn't he have been swelling up with the others now if he was suffering from the same affliction?

"Ugh...can't get comfortable..." Jake said with a grunt. He unbuckled his belt and let out a satisfied groan as his belly bulged forward slightly. "Much better..."

It was hard to believe these were the same two guys who had been his star players only a few weeks ago. Brad hardly recognized them anymore. He inched the car forward slightly as the traffic began to move, but soon had to hit the brakes after moving no further than a meter.

Rrrrrrrrrrrrrrrrrip!

S sudden tearing noise from beside Brad diverted his attention away from the cars and to his passengers. "Erm...what was that?"

Jake gulped nervously and looked down at his pants, but they seemed to be in tact, and his T-shirt had managed to hold on. It wasn't him.

"Uh...guys...it's happening again!"

Jake and Brad turned their heads and looked into the back seat, where Jackson was sitting with his legs spread, huge tears appearing along his jeans, which were starting up tear apart at the seams. Jackson tried to hold the fabric together, but his efforts only sped up the process, ripping his pants apart noisily as his flabby legs burst free.

"Oh shit!" Jake cried out as he watched his friend bloat up once again.

"Urghhhhh...no more!" Jackson moaned as the last of his jeans fell apart, leaving him in his rapidly shrinking boxer shorts and his open shirt.

Pop!

Finally, they made it to the hospital. The tires on Brad's car screeched noisily as he raced into the emergency parking zone and bolted out of the car, opening up the doors for his friends. Jake and Jackson groaned and moaned as they swung their legs out of the car and struggled to get out. Their shirts lay in tatters on the floor of Brad's car, and they both looked hugely embarrassed as they were forced to enter the hospital half naked; Jake in just his shoes and underwear and Jackson in his unbuttoned jeans. Their topless bodies exposed, bellies jiggling as they hurried inside, you wouldn't have believed they were once lean, muscular football players.

As they entered the reception area, they saw it was jam packed. There must have been about two hundred people here, all pushing and jostling one another as they struggled to get to the front desk. Brad gestured for Jake and Jackson to go and take a seat, which they did, blushing red with embarrassment and receiving some very odd looks.

It took Brad some time to reach the front of the queue, but his journey there was quite interesting; at the front of the line was a blonde haired girl who was frantically trying to explain that she had had some sort of bad allergic reaction and needed something to 'stop the swelling' as soon as possible. When she was told to take a seat, she stormed past Brad angrily, and he saw that her breasts were enormous, practically bursting out of her shirt!

"Yes, sir?" The tired nurse on duty finally called him forward.

"Oh hey," Brad said, shuffling towards the desk. "My two friends over there just started swelling up. They'd been putting on some weight lately anyway but we were out to dinner and they just started bloating up. It was crazy."

The nurse looked over at her colleague. "We got another one!"

"Another one?" Brad asked, curious.

"Cases like this have been coming in all night," the Nurse said. "Just take a look behind you."

Brad turned around and examined the waiting room more closely; he saw Jack and Jackson staring down in disbelief at their bloated guts, then began to notice other cases. A very muscular, topless guy in the corner. The big breasted blonde from earlier. A sobbing pregnant girl with a torn shirt. Whatever had effected his friends also seemed to be effecting these people as well. Some sort of weird growth sickness or something.

"So...what is it?" He asked.

"We don't know, but the waiting list is huge," the Nurse said. "We've got every Doctor on emergency call tonight. The wait is pretty long, you might want to leave them here and get some sleep. Odds are, your friends will be here a long time."

Brad gave the Nurse their details, then went to explain to Jake and Jackson that he was going home. "Look guys, the nurse says it'll be a while. I need to head back. Besides, no offense but I don't really want to catch what you have."

"No worries dude," Jake said.

"Understandable," Jackson said. "I wish people would stop staring at us though..."

"Just take a look at that girl's boobs," Brad gestured to the blonde. "That should take your mind off it."

That seemed to work, as the guys were now staring intently at her swollen cleavage. Brad returned to his car and headed back home...

They were discussing this simple programming assignment while they were drinking sodas and eating their granola bars, while typing at their computer keyboards with their sticky fingers.

Dean was the lab assistant there. He was only fifteen years old, he wore glasses, he was skinny as a rail and he had brown hair and eyes. He had no muscle on him at all. He looked over at the sign which had rules spelled out in fat, red letters: “No Food Or Drink Allowed in the Computer Lab”.

He took a deep breath and walked over to where the two football players were sitting.

Chad and Mitch just stared at the skinny lab assistant.

“Alright. Sorry, Dean. Besides, we need to go to the gym…” Chad said, as he picked up his notebook and backpack.

He slapped Dean on his back, almost sending the skinny guy sailing to the floor, before walking out the door, with Mitch behind him.

“Look at this mess…” Dean sighed, as he ran his finger over the edge of the keyboard that Chad had been using, not knowing that he was coming in contact with the expansion virus. “I need to wipe down the mouse and the keyboard again!”

“Oh come on, Dean!” one of the girls said, as she walked by. “These guys had just grown big and muscular within the past few weeks!”

“I bet they spend more time lifting weights in the gym than studying!” Dean scowled.

“Yeah…” Sandra giggled. “But it has helped. Look at them! They have gained so much muscle recently! They used to be skinny, like you!”

“Yeah well I’m smarter than them and I’m never gonna be a musclehead like those guys!” Dean remarked, as he wiped down the keyboards and the mice with a cloth. “I’m gonna be a geek all my life!”

Dean finished his shift in the computer lab before he packed his backpack and went home.

Dean went to bed that night, since he was feeling very tired. He was up late working on a C# computer program, and then he spent some time writing the HTML code for another gaming website he was designing. Typical for a geek like him. He was living in a small apartment with his mother since his parents were divorced. He had no siblings since he was an only child. In his bedroom, he had a chair and a desk on one end, his bed on the other, and a large bookcase filled with computer books along with a large collection of books covering a everything from math, biology, physics, science, chemistry and astronomy. Dean would read four books per week, and he would spend his remaining free time at the computer or in the library. The last thing on his mind was playing sports or working out in the gym.

Strangely enough, Dean woke up around 4 o’clock in the morning and he was starving! That was weird, since he had dinner with his mom the previous evening. He had never felt so hungry before in his life! What was going on?

He got out of bed and went into the bathroom. His stomach was rumbling out loud, like it was begging for food! So, he walked into the kitchen and he poured himself a glass of milk and he made himself a peanut butter sandwich just to satisfy the odd hunger.

As soon as he finished eating and walked up to the sink to wash the dishes, he was overcome by an odd cramp in his muscles! In every muscle in his body! What was going on? Was he feeling sick all of the sudden? He had no idea that the expansion virus was now having its effect on his body, and it was attacking his muscles! Dean’s muscles were screaming for fuel! They needed to grow! Now!

“What the heck?” Dean whispered to himself. “I must be coming down with the flu or something! I feel… weird!”

Suddenly, his calves began to inflate! His leg-muscles slowly bulged out from the back of his legs, filling out with muscle. They hardened and stiffened at first, before they pushed out from the back of his thin, skinny legs. Now, those legs were no longer skinny. Thick, rock-hard calf muscles were inflating just below his knees, roaring to life with powerful muscle!

Next, Dean’s quads began to thicken and widen, all at once. His thin, stick-like legs quickly doubled in width! But they didn’t gain an ounce of fat! They exploded with amazing slabs and layers of rock-solid muscle, packing on layers upon layers over his skinny legs above the knees. Thick rope-like veins suddenly came to the surface as the boy’s once-skinny legs suddenly took the shape of legs belonging to a professional soccer player or a professional runner. Outrageous slabs of muscle, the size of steel columns formed on his legs, making them look like rocket boosters!

“What… What’s happening?” Dean panted as he looked down and noticed how his skinny legs suddenly became incredibly muscled! “This… This is impossible!”

Then, he became hungry again! He was starving! He was famished! He ran towards the fridge and opened it, just to find anything else to eat. He spotted the leftover pizza and a frozen TV dinner.

He quickly heated up the pizza in the microwave as his legs continued to grow more muscular. Then the growth stopped, but he was still hungry!

What would happen next?

151.content:
We join a lesbian couple just past their second year anniversary as they struggle with the virus and the changes it brings...

Keiko: A tad shy at meeting new people, she nonetheless took the initiative and asked her future wife out. With long dark hair, brown eyes, and a kind heart, she does her best to cope with the new world she wakes up to.

Elly: Far more outgoing than her wife but fiercely protective of Keiko, Elly's usual approach to life involves taking things one day at a time. Brash, confident, and a little hot-headed, Elly strives to still be her wife's pillar of support even as the virus changes the entirety of humanity. Shoulder-length red hair, dark eyes, and a world-beating grin ensure that she's ready for just about anything, even a fattening plague.

///

Keiko opened her eyes to a few rays of sunlight streaming through the bedroom window, noticing soon after that her wife wasn't cuddling up against her. Despite Elly's outgoing tomboyish-demeanor, she craved cuddles when they were in bed. Sitting up fully, the Japanese-American called out for her wife, receiving a panicked whimper in response from the slightly open bathroom door.

Eyes narrowing, Keiko got up and dashed over towards the source of that whimper. Elly never sounded like that.

Opening the door, she gaped a bit but soon had her wife in her arms.

Or as much of her as she could hold onto.

Elly was fat. Not strictly obese but certainly up there in weight. Her stomach was a pot-belly verging on gut and her rear was even larger than that, the red-head trembling a bit as she looked into the mirror, finally realizing that her wife was holding her.

"I...I was burning up and came in here to see if I had a flu and then I...I felt full and then I looked down and-" but she was cut off by her own whimpers as she broke down, Keiko murmuring what comfort she could while recalling a few news reports from last week about bizarre cases of people expanding...transforming...all over the world.

But what she thought was just a series of panic typical in a twenty four hour news cycle was now terribly real.

"You're still my wife, Elly, regardless of your size, and we'll get through this together, I promise."

"Y-yeah," Elly replied, a ghost of a smile on her face, "we will, won't we?"

Keiko nodded before she faltered a bit, vision growing blurry as she fell forward onto Elly's stomach, her wife's frantic cries the last thing she heard as she passed out...
151.title: Suburbia-A Couple's Gain, Loss, and Life

1522.content:
My backpack hing heavely om my back, and my beard was covered in bits of snow. There was a steady drizzle from the overcasted sky, and the cold winds blew against my jacket. It will be dark soon. And in darkness, even this far in the woods, things where dangerous. The chanches that an infected could find me was still high, and the best option was to find a safe place to rest for the night, particularly one with a roof.

As I made my way down the old hunter's trail, my mind drifted off to the day this nightmare comenced. It was at least four monthes ago, on a warm july day. I, it seemed to me back then, was the only one who wasn't infected by the virus. I was luckely the first to witness the virus take hold, and the first to get the hell out of there. Back then I was just an ordinary guy, but now i'm a survivore.

I packed my travel bag and headed out to the forest, to a place I hope no one would find me. It was so far a misareble journey. Starvation, cold, and infected was a constent threight. I got lucky dozens of times. I often stumbled on supermarkets still full of food (or at least that was not completely raided), but my attemptes at survival was oftenly met infected. I had some close calls; one time I came across a farm with his owner still present. He was a young man (I prosumed at least twenty) that still holded his father's land.

He was friendly, surprissingly, and even gave me food. It was later that I discovered that the young lad had his parents imprisoned in his basement, apperently suffering from the virus. I could hear their moanes from upstairs, and got the hell out of there.

These are dangerous times indeed. My eyes fell upon a wooden structure standing in the forest. From closer inspection, I saw that it was a cabin. Peering through the window, I saw spiderwebs and furniture covered in layers of dust. From the looks of it, I could see that the place hasn't been inhabited in a long while.

The door, surprisingly, was open. It creaked loudly on its hangs. The room had an eerie presence. I half expected that an infected or some kind of monster would sprung out at me, but luckely it never happened. There was musky old mattress in the corner. Too exausted to continue, I fell down on it, unable to press further on.

15233.content:
With aching feet and half-wet clothes, Herman made his way down the hill. Over his back hung his heavy his heavy backpack, filled with the last resources that he originally started with. In his right hand he carried a black briefcase, a prized companion he protected with his life. He glanced back over his shoulder; dark, ominous woods stood behind him, leaves rustling in the wind. It was almost dark, and the temperatures where plummeting.

Steam rouse from Herman's mouth as he quickly made for the town down below in the valley. 'Almost there,' he thought. It came to no surprise that this large town was devoid of life, but to Herman any form of civilization was better then none. The streets where eerily quiet: cars stood abandoned, buildings' windows where smashed open, and plant life grew everywhere.

Slowly making his way down the streets, Herman spotted movement in a nearby shopping market. He wasn't sure, but it almost looked like light from a fire. Feeling relieved that some sort of life was here in this ghost-town, Herman made his way to the market.

The Frosty Market was the name of the establishment, painted on a sign with bold-letters. It was not large, just a small business selling basic food products. The main door was boarded shut, no way for him to enter through here. Perhaps there was a door at the back? Every shop must have a delivery point in the back?

To find out, Herman cautiously made his way around the back. But when he did so, loud moaning sounds was audible. Peering around the corner, Herman spotted a enormously fat man banging on the pack of the garage door. From his torn jeans, filthy ragged shirt, messy beard and hair, Herman could determine that this man was a hobo, infected by the virus a while back.

He turned his bloated head and spotted Herman. "Food," he bellowed. He advanced towards Herman in a rather slow pace. Quick and easily, Herman was able to flank the fat slob and headed towards the garage door. From the excessive banging, the door was open only wide enough for Herman to crawl through.

Ones inside, he shut close the door, properly closing it. The banging resumed, but the creature was luckily outside. Herman got to his feet and proceeded to invade the store.

153332222.title: Leah, the drugstore cashier

choices: "...Received a hefty pay raise for your hardwork."
"...Were moved back to do pharmaceuticals."
1533322221.content:
Ah, the inner city Dogan Drugstore. Nobody sells top shelf generic brand merchandise, products, and of course, prescription drugs, quite like the Dogan Drugstore. Always hustling and bustling with wild fluctuations of people coming in and out for groceries or last minute birthday party gifts.

The store works like a well-oiled machine. Every employee fulfills his or her duty quickly and at the utmost, efficiently. Well, except for one somewhat absent minded employee. This particular employee works at register five or as the others call it, the slow lane. Leah actually knew how to do her job well. It was extremely simple to work a cash register.

However, Leah tended to daydream a lot. Customers would have to go to some extent to capture her attention, but once captured she would get the items scanned and bagged just as quick as anyone else.

“Um, ‘scuse me.”

Here’s an example now. Her fine light brown skinned face had that thousand-yard stare, albeit with a pleasant smile. No doubt, someone was having a fantastic daydream. What she was thinking about was up to anyone’s guess. Leah wasn’t very open to the other employees. She ate her lunch quietly and quick, often keeping her eyes glued to her phone. Well, that and her resting bitch face scared off new people.

“Excuse me!”

Her only other action was her index finger curly her wavy black hair and the occasional blink.

“MA’AM!”

Finally, her attention was captured by a hand quickly waving in her face. Leah snapped to attention and noticed the plethora of groceries loaded onto the conveyer belt, “Sorry about that. Did you find everything okay?”

She looked over to see a couple. A tall and muscular couple. Both man and woman stood over her five foot seven frame.

“Yes, we did,” the woman spoke up, “Are you okay? You seem out of it.”

Leah giggled, “Ah, I tend to daydream a lot.”

The couple shook their head, “We get it.”

Although, they both look like they had been hitting the gym for quite sometime. Their clothes didn’t reflect their lifestyle. The two looked equally geeky with unfitting clothes and stretch marks around certain areas. Almost as if all those muscles came damn near overnight.

“So. I take it you two go to the gym often?”

The couple laughed nervously, “Yeah,” the man said flexing his mighty bicep, “We’re still kinda new to it though. Hehe.”

Leah had noted these two were getting a lot of protein powders, food, and supplemental vitamins. They must be body builders of some sort, but something seemed a little off.

The final item made its way into the bag, “Okay. Your total comes to 131.74 will that be cash or credit.”

The man sneezed into his hand. Despite, the offputtingness of his action, he still handed Leah the money.

“Cash. You can keep the change.”

Leah counted up the bills and placed them in the register, “Thanks for choosing Dogan. Have a nice day!”

She watched as the couple walked away. Something about the way they walked made it even more obvious that there was some wrong with those two. Like they were uncomfortable in their own bodies. Leah, however, decided to shrug it off, “Musta just got done with leg day.”

Still she wondered while getting a literal handful of disinfectant. Is it all that food and supplements they bought what gave them all of that muscle? Leah knew her paycheck couldn’t cover that kind of expense, but given the money she would gladly venture into that kind of high-calorie/high-protein diet. And maybe hit the gym a few times a week.

Then she remembered their clothing and how tight they clung to their figures. Leah, wasn’t the one to do that. She rather liked the bagginess of her own clothing. Baggy jeans and loose fitting t-shirts did her fine. Gave her enough circulation to breathe and cool off while still remaining fashionable.

Leah looked to the right and saw no one incoming. In fact, the store had hit one of it’s lows in traffic. Time to daydream.

She rested her head on her hand and began to drift off when-

“Leah.”

Her trip to dream land was derailed by her manager, Kara, entering the scene. She too stood taller than Leah, but like Leah, she had a sleek and sexy build with Leah beating her in the asset department. Except that Kara had become bloated as of recent. Everybody had noticed the manager carrying around a clear jug of water. Constantly taking big gulps from it. As a result she had become bloated in appearance.

The manager didn’t let working in a drug store stop her from dressing professionally too. A black over coat with a complimenting peach button up made her more intimidating than a regular stuck up manager. The way her long black skirt with a cut flowed as she walked and clacking off her black high heels did ring a bell of terror as she walked through the store.

Kara set down her water jug and stifled a belch,. Her thin framed glasses and hair tied tightly in a pony tail screamed ‘I am a professional. Don’t screw up or it’ll be your head’, “Leah. I’ve been going over performance reports over the past six months and I’ve noticed a…change in your behavior.”

Leah gulped nervously. Was this the moment when she would be handed the pink slip and lose her source of income? Please don’t let it be so.

“And I figured it would be best for the crew, I, and you, if you…”
1533322221.title: Leah has a work day unlike any other

"Alright folks, just because we're quarantined doesn't mean we're off the clock." said Pam, tucking her phone back into her pocket.

Geoff let out a groan, and received a swift punch in the arm from his boss.

"Geoff, stop complaining already, damn it! I've got enough trouble as it already is. Angela, Lester, you two go take tunnel 29, make sure it's still stable. I'll take lunk head over here and go clear out the cave in in 19."

Angela and Lester nodded before heading out. Geoff grimaced.

"More rock shoveling for the strong man I see."

"That's about the only thing you're good for these days, so get moving and put those arms to work!"

Following this were several hours of backbreaking labor for the middle aged man. Tunnel 19 had had a series of collapses in the past, and despite being reinforced multiple times would repeatedly fall apart again. But it was essential to maintain it as it carried one of the main pipelines that carried the cities water supply. So, for the third time in two weeks, Geoff had to attempt to repair what was clearly a losing battle.

Finally, Geoff could pause to take a breath as he cleared the final piece of rubble that blocked the service way. Wiping the sweat from his bro, he stood triumphant over the rocks once more. A glowing aura surrounded him as women bowed down and worshiped him. In his mind at least.

Activating his nearby radio, he called over the airwaves to his companions in tunnel 29.

"Tunnel 19 is clear, you can unseal the pipes."

A garbled reply came from the other end, but sure enough a few moments later Geoff heard the rushing of water once more. He needed a brake.

However, it was at that moment that the pipe next to him, partially damaged by the rock slide decided to give way. A torrential spray of water gushed out of the unseen hole, catching him straight in the face. Flailing his arms, Geoff attempted to block the stream while frantically calling over the intercom.

"TURN IT OFF! TURN IT OFF GOD DAMN IT! THE PIPE'S BLOWN!"

By the time Pam had arrived, sprinting down the tunnel from an adjacent one, the deluge had stopped, but the damage was done. Geoff stood there with a massive snarl on his face, soaked from head to toe. Still, he somehow managed to compose himself in front of his boss.

"I know, I know, I should have checked the pipe. Everything's fine, don't worry. I'm okay, not that you'd care." he sighed, putting his head in his hand. "I figure we can get a welder up here from the supply depot and fix this real quick. There's no real structural damaged apparent beside that, but I'll have to check more."

Looking back up, he was both surprised and annoyed to see Pam gaping at him with a look of pure shock.

"What? I know, I messed up! Dock my pay if you want to!" he said angrily.

But Pam merely shook his head, raising a lone finger to point at his body.

1542.content:
The Crown Plaza Hotel. Formerly a quality 4 star, self-contained holiday resort, but now had been left to rot. A week had passed since the E-virus had infiltrated the resort, apparently braking out on the 6th floor of the 9 storey hotel, and the government had condemned the infected and uninfected alike to their fates. As no cure had been discovered yet, it was safer to establish quarantines to contain the virus, the Crown Plaza Hotel resort and surrounding grounds had been quickly cordoned off after the outbreak there and was designated Quarantine: Crown Plaza. Although this was not the only quarantined zone.

While more and more of the guests at the resort had become infected, there were small pockets who had managed to remain hidden for the past week. Most of these had barricaded themselves in their rooms, only venturing out at night (when it was apparently safer) to gather supplies from the vast food court, and the small warehouse hidden in a hillside within the resort, however not many knew of this.

One of these hidden groups of uninfected guests were holed up on the 3rd floor, in room 267. Inside were four girls; Claire, Rachel, Mississippi (or Missi to her friends) and Mary. All four were in their early twenties and had only been on holiday for 2 days before the outbreak. Luckily for them they had all been in their room when the infection started to escalate. That is, except for the 5th member of their group; Kirsty. She had been out, booking the group's spa session when the virus began to rapidly spread through the hotel and resort, the other girls hadn't seen her since.

"Well I didn't think we would have spent this much time just in our room," Mary chirped wryly. "I knew we should've gone abroad but you wanted us all to go to Crown Plaza," snapped Rachel, angling an angry stare towards Missi. "Oh it's amazing! Oh you'll love it! Look how fucking great it is now!" continued Rachel in a mocking tone, pointing out the window, down at the deserted resort and its attractions, save for a few infected ambling around, with the government installed perimeter fence just visible in the distance. "How was I supposed to know!" retorted Missi. Claire had the coolest head between the four and tried to make peace, "Ok you two, cool it! Rachel, just leave off. Shouting and arguing won't help". "What we need to do is get some more supplies, I think we'll have run out by tomorrow evening," said Mary. "Or escape" chimed in Missi, "But I thought you loved it here..." quipped Rachel. "Fuck off!", Missi responded in a wounded tone. "Hey! We've got to stick together," Claire said trying to calm matters, "We need to decide what to do".

After tempers had simmered down, the girls managed to put together some ideas about what action to take. "I'm still worried about Kirsty. What if she's infected, or hiding somewhere?" pined Mary. "If she is infected, there's not much we can do.... But we can't really just abandon her in case she isn't," added Claire. After much deliberation, the quartet had had narrowed down their choices to the three most sensible courses of action. "Ok girls. So what are we going to do?"

info.description:
A virus has spread across the world, causing people to undergo transformations which leave their bodies in an expanded state. Two weeks after the virus was first released, a group of students try to escape the city without succumbing to it's effects, but that's easier said than done...

Anything expansion wise goes: Weight Gain, Giant/Giantess, Muscle Growth, Breast Expansion, Butt Expansion, Blueberry, Belly Expansion, Pregnancy, Inflation and whatever else I might have missed.
